metadata.name: Data Export From MSSQL Table Via BCP.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of the BCP utility in order to export data from the database. Attackers were seen saving their malware to a database column or table and then later extracting it via "bcp.exe" into a file.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\bcp.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('bcp.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' out ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' queryout '))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of the BCP utility in order to export data from the database. Attackers were seen saving their malware to a database column or table and then later extracting it via "bcp.exe" into a file.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate data export operations.
